title: Introduction to Timorese Food Systems and Cultural Context

questions.question: What is the geographical location of Timor-Leste?
choices: North of Australia in Southeast Asia
South of China in East Asia
East of India in South Asia
West of Papua New Guinea in Oceania
questions.answer: North of Australia in Southeast Asia

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a staple food in traditional Timorese cuisine?
When did Portuguese colonization of Timor-Leste begin?
Which crop, introduced by the Portuguese, became a significant export for Timor-Leste?
What is the period of Indonesian occupation in Timor-Leste?
Which of the following is a traditional Timorese cooking method?
What is 'batar daan'?
choices: A corn and red beans stew
questions.answer: A corn and red beans stew

questions.question: Which of the following crops was NOT introduced by Portuguese colonizers?
What is 'budu' in Timorese cuisine?
When did Timor-Leste gain full independence?
Which of the following best describes the terrain of Timor-Leste?
choices: Mountainous with a narrow coastal plain
questions.answer: Mountainous with a narrow coastal plain

questions.question: What is 'saboko' in Timorese cuisine?
choices: Fish or meat wrapped in palm leaves and steamed
questions.answer: Fish or meat wrapped in palm leaves and steamed

questions.question: Which historical event brought tempeh and instant noodles to Timorese cuisine?
choices: Japanese occupation during World War II

questions.question: What is 'kafe Timor'?
Which of the following is NOT a challenge facing Timorese food systems in the post-independence era?
What role did wild foods play in traditional Timorese diets?
choices: They were only used for medicinal purposes
They were important in the diet and during food shortages
They were exclusively used in religious ceremonies
questions.answer: They were important in the diet and during food shortages

questions.question: Which of the following is a Portuguese influence on Timorese cuisine?
choices: Integration of some Portuguese dishes (e.g., caldo)
questions.answer: Integration of some Portuguese dishes (e.g., caldo)

questions.question: What is 'food sovereignty' in the context of Timor-Leste?
choices: The right to export all food produced
The right to import all food consumed
The right to healthy and culturally appropriate food produced through sustainable methods
The right to refuse any foreign food aid
questions.answer: The right to healthy and culturally appropriate food produced through sustainable methods

questions.question: Which crop became a staple in many parts of Timor-Leste after its introduction by the Portuguese?
What is 'bibingka' in Timorese cuisine?
How did the Indonesian occupation affect Timorese agriculture?
What is 'ikan sabuko'?
Which of the following is NOT a staple ingredient in traditional Timorese cuisine?
What impact has urbanization had on Timorese dietary habits?
choices: Increased reliance on imported processed foods
questions.answer: Increased reliance on imported processed foods

questions.question: Which historical period saw the introduction of wet rice cultivation to Timor-Leste?
What is the significance of buffalo meat in Timorese culture?
choices: It's the most commonly consumed meat

questions.question: Which of the following is a challenge to Timorese food systems posed by climate change?
What is 'modo-tahan' in Timorese cuisine?
Which of the following best describes the current state of Timorese cuisine?
choices: Purely traditional with no outside influences
A blend of indigenous, Portuguese, and Indonesian influences
questions.answer: A blend of indigenous, Portuguese, and Indonesian influences

questions.question: What role does foraging play in contemporary Timorese food culture?
choices: It remains important, especially in rural areas
It is only practiced for medicinal purposes
It is illegal due to conservation laws
questions.answer: It remains important, especially in rural areas
